div.p: A OFFICIAL who acts as as ASSISTANT to a RULER.
1. The general word for a government minister at any level and of any kind is chén 臣, generically rén chén 人臣.
2. Zuǒ yòu 左右 refers to the senior ministers in the immediate environment of a king or duke who were able, ex officio, to speak up in court.
3. Xiàng 相 refers to the head of the group of ministers, the prime minister, also called yǐn 尹 or lìng yǐn 令尹 in the southern state of Chǔ.
4. Qīng 卿 refers to a member of the group fo senior ministers, variously defined.
The list of senior official titles in ancient China is long indeed. See Hucker and Zuo Yandong's monograph.
三九 (obs) is short for 三公九卿
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

sense.def: SHIJI: office of vice head or assistant officer 守丞 "fill office of..."

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

sense.def: head of an administrative unit 縣令

entry.def: Qīng 卿 refers to a member of the group fo senior ministers, variously defined.

sense.def: senior minister; Chief Minister; high officer 二卿
minister in charge dū wèi 都尉 "minister in charge of military affairs", chief of staff

entry.def: Xiàng 相 refers to the head of the group of ministers, the prime minister, also called yǐn 尹 or lìng yǐn 令尹 in the southern state of Chǔ.

sense.def: prime minister (in any country, including Chǔ 楚)
prime ministership; position of a prime minister 受相 "accept the position of prime minister"
make into a prime minister, install as prime minister
guide and assist (primarily as prime minister or the like)
act as prime minister for (a state); become prime minister of
make N1 prime minister in N2
prime ministership of the contextually determinate state of N
act as prime minister in N

entry.def: The general word for a government minister at any level and of any kind is chén 臣, generically rén chén 人臣.

sense.def: minister of the contextually determinate superordinate person
the minister in general, ministers in general
treat like a minister, treat as a minister
gain as a minister; make into a minister; take as a servant
definite: the ministers of the contextually determinate N
be the minister of the contextually determinate N
be a servant, public servant; minister
the senior three ministers (differently defined for Zhou court and Han bureaucracy)
the status of a senior minister
the Nine Ministers (See Michael Loewe, Crisis and Conflict, p. 310.
acting as a minister of someone else

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

entry.def: Refers to a minister completely under one's control.

sense.def: those facing north> ministers facing north
Minister of the Right [in the state of Chu]
Minister of Urban Development; minister of works

entry.def: Sī kòu 司寇 was a leading official in charge of punishment. The office was established already under the Three dynasties.

sense.def: Minister of Justice (same as 司寇）

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Official Titles in Imperial China

sense.def: minister of works (see also 大司空 "grand minister of works")

entry.def: Sīmǎ 司馬 refers to a very senior military official in the bureaucracy of the capital of a state.

sense.def: senior ministers of the contextually determinate ruler
of a household: grand steward; of a state: Senior Minister in charge of the 六典, the Six Ministries, for which see ZHOULI.
Invited Senior Minister Npr (title in Qin)
Minister of the Left (in the state of Chu3)

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

entry.def: Zuǒ yòu 左右 refers to the senior ministers in the immediate environment of a king or duke who were able, ex officio, to speak up in court.

sense.def: the members of the close political entourage (of a king etc), aide; senior employees of a household
the aforementioned member of (N's) close entourage
indefinite: a member of his senior group of close entourage or advisors/ministers
vaguely universal quantification: the ministers (of N), the entourage; some members of the entourage (of N)
prime minister Npr SHIJI: 相國呂不韋
one's (hypothetical) subordinates, ministers of all kinds
the definite subordinates of a concrete king (HSWZ)
powerful ministers/persons at court; political heavyweights
subsidiary minister (typically one who comes from a state other than that he is serving in)
the ministers; the senior officials at court
the ministers; the senior officials at court
